casebody.data:
MEINCK
v.
CITY OF GASTONIA 130PA17-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. October 16, 2017 Thomas D. Bumgardner, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for Meinck, Joan A. Martha Raymond Thompson, Attorney at Law, Gastonia, Ryan L. Bostic, Attorney at Law, Aaron C. Low, Attorney at Law, Gastonia, for City of Gastonia. Andrew J. Santaniello, Attorney at Law, Kimberly S. Hibbard, General Counsel, Gregory F. Schwitzgebel, III, Associate General Counsel, for N.C. Association of Defense Attorneys, et al. Huntington M. Willis, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, William R. Terpening, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for N.C. Advocates for Justice.

The following order has been entered on the Motion for Extension of Time to File *741Reply Brief filed on the 13th of October 2017 by Defendant:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 16th of October 2017."

Defendant shall have up to and including the 6th day of November 2017 to file and serve his/her brief with this Court.
